clinical_study.brief_title: Invasive Ventilation for Neonates With Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome(ARDS)
clinical_study.official_title: Selective High Frequency Oscillation Ventilation(HFOV) vs Conventional Mechanical Ventilation(CMV) for Neonates With Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome(ARDS):an Multicenters Randomized Controlled Trial

clinical_study.source: Daping Hospital and the Research Institute of Surgery of the Third Military Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) in neonates has been defined in 2017.The death rate is over 50%. HFOV and CMV are two main invasive ventilation strategies. However, which one is better needing to be further elucidated.

detailed_description.textblock: Severe acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) is one of the serious complications in critically ill neonates. It can result in severe hypoxemia refractory to mechanical ventilation. Usually, invasive ventilation with low parameters is enough for neonates with mild and moderate ARDS. And extracorporeal membrane oxygenation is used to neonates with severe ARDS. However, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation can also lead to high death rate and need more technique and conditions. Mechanical ventilation with higher parameters was a substitute for such situations, but the death rate, complications and injuries of higher parameters is unknown. The purpose of the present study was to compare HFOV with CMV as invasive respiratory support strategies on decrease the mortality and morbidities in neonate with ARDS.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: When the neonate had fulfilled the included criteria, selective HFOV or CMV were started immediately on the basis of the group assignment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after birth or 36 weeks'gestational age
primary_outcome.description: the included neonate was diagnosed with BPD

primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after birth or 36 weeks'gestational age or before discharge
primary_outcome.description: the included preterm infants were dead

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence of neonatal necrotizing enterocolitis(NEC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after birth or 36 weeks'gestational age or before discharge
secondary_outcome.description: the included neonate was diagnosed with NEC

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence of retinopathy of prematurity(ROP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after birth or 36 weeks'gestational age or before discharge
secondary_outcome.description: the included neonate was diagnosed with ROP

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after birth or 36 weeks'gestational age or before discharge
28 days after birth or 36 weeks'gestational age or before discharge
28 days after birth or 36 weeks'gestational age or before discharge
secondary_outcome.description: the included neonate was diagnosed with airleak

arm_group.description: Ventilated infants were randomized to HFOV.
Ventilated infants were randomized to CMV.
